result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond R Pinch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $167 VW & DA surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Dept of Corrections.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.
No threats/acts of violence against: Melissa F.

Eligible for early termination at 12 months with agent approval.  Completion of DOC domestic violence treatment.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA on file.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond R Pinch

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

2:08 PM Defendant Raymond R Pinch in court with Attorney Marshall Lemaster Belton.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count 1  

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Use of a Dangerous Weapon on Count 2. 
 .
Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #2   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months. Eligible for early termination at 12 months with agent approval.

CONDITIONS:
-No threats/acts of violence against: Melissa F.
-DOC DV treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. DA surcharge and V/W surcharge due on probation

-Days credit for time already served: 1 day credit 
-Days credit if revoked: 1 day credit

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Abby H./minutes sent to DOC
Defn appeared in person with Atty Belton. ADA Nelson appeared in person. Set for Plea/Sent; NIH.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
ADA Lillian Nelson appeared for the State. Defn appeared without counsel. Defn applied for SPD and was approved. STC scheduled, NIH.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Melissa F. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

09:13 AM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
